comment.body: I used mpc which is a frontend to mpd (music player daemon). The cool thing is that there are a ton of frontends to mpd (mobile, web, GUI, console)
Cool! great! tanks!
C.H.I.P. can only accept pre-orders payd with PayPal. I cancelled my PayPal account last year ater reading enough horror stories.
@Musickiller: Runtime speed is usually not an issue with GUI toolkits. The user is slower than the computer anyway. I never coded GTK. But QT is really nice to work with.
@Musickiller: MFC is a headache!
I once had a similar experience with BitMessage. The delay was about four months.

I remember when I was 12 the bank promised I would get a plastic card with 14. But when I was 14 they didn't deliver without a reason. I remember just too well how pissed off I was. The rules in BitCoin are not changed that easily.
Apart from the traditional methods, how about ipfs or zeronet to make the transfer?

@Musickiller: I use rsync mainly or syncing recursive directory structures. with the -u option only files with newer timestamps are transferred. With the -c option, only files with different checksums are transferred.
They might want to add some privacy before people should use it to distribute movies. Or what kind of files were you thinking about?
How did you take that picture? Some sort of thermal imaging?
From what I read it's only a problem on Windows.
They do different things, but with a similar spirit.
A .deb would be great. I tried that in the past, but a working setup.py would be the pre-condition.
@Nofish: I saw that there is already a snap. But when I tried to install it, I got a login page from canonical. That felt very strange.

@Nofish: I have been running zeronet from source with the dependencies from the standard debs in ubuntu for something more than a year. Never noticed an issue with outdated packages. Things might be different for Debian itself, maybe.
Is RMS active on zeronet yet? Or would that be his condition?
Did I read that correctly, that you can run debian or ubuntu on it? Do they provide updated kernels?
@ZAlex: Cool. That really makes it interesting. Did you order it already, and when is the expected delivery? Keep us updated.

Yes, I recently attended a [talk that involved emscripten](http://isocpp.org/feeder/?FeederAction=clicked&feed=All+Posts&seed=http%3A%2F%2Fisocpp.org%2Fblog%2F2017%2F01%2Fimplementing-a-web-game-in-cpp14-kris-jusiak-meeting-c-2016&seed_title=Implementing+a+web+game+in+C%2B%2B14+-+Kris+Jusiak+-+Meeting+C%2B%2B+2016). I wanted to experiment some more with it, but lacking the time to do so.
@ZAlex: ... late February .... which year?
I didn't read through yet, but it reminds me a lot of "Iâ€™ve Got The Music In Me" from [PwningTomorrow.epub](https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmNsqLLdq8HyEzPBsrjJB9UCebofsYYeDxvSwd3TnVAxFC) by the eff.

This looks like a good service from the user perspective. But it also looks like piracy. What I would really like was a way to pay for the content with Bitcoin, and be sure it reaches the author. Not many content creators published donation addresses, not even Cory Doctorow. I know there is a long way to go. Buying through the established channels can be horribly inconvenient. Most of the time I can't get DRM free eBooks nor pay with Bitcoin. But just downloading doesn't feel right neither.

Something other that comes to mind: [Fahrenheit 451](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fahrenheit_451_%28film%29) which was the inspiration for the new [http 451](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_451) code for censorship.
From the twister newsfeed:  eBook Pirates Are Relatively Old and Wealthy, Study Finds http://j.mp/2mvxzcJ #afeat #News #Digimarc #eBooks
@Arsene Lupin: From the article I'm not sure if they understand that DRM is a mayor inconvenience factor that drives potential customers away.
LTC miners started signalling for SegWit
Looks like a good time to become a cop.
Oh yes, post the stl files
Sounds like 1984
I have been running a mesh node for probably more than 5 years. But I'm not aware of any other mesh node in the vicinity. So the only reason I keep it alive is wishful thinking.
Yeah I got a coupon last week. But they only support PayPal, which I stopped using altogether. And shipping and tax and handling would surely add up to more than the device itself.

@Uv: Full details are [on my blog](https://ulrichard.ch/blog/?p=26)  It is still running on an [alix](http://pcengines.ch/alix.htm) board. It runs ubuntu and the packaged  OLSRd. The rest is manually configured to resemble what was described at openwireless.ch (similar to freifunk.net) at the time.
@Kaffie: I put new posts on both, but didn't get around to porting the old posts yet.
